root

rootroot node represents the root node of a tree. [19.2 Trees ]
Modulenets â€” Graphs, networks, and trees
Attributes
  • att.global ( @xml:id, @n, @xml:lang, @xml:base, @xml:space ) (att.global.rendition ( @rend, @style, @rendition ) ) (att.global.linking ( @corresp, @synch, @sameAs, @copyOf, @next, @prev, @exclude, @select ) ) (att.global.analytic ( @ana ) ) (att.global.facs ( @facs ) ) (att.global.change ( @change ) ) (att.global.responsibility ( @cert, @resp ) ) (att.global.source ( @source ) )
    • @value
    identifies the root node of the network by pointing to a feature structure or other analytic element.
    Usage
    opt
    Datatype
    teidata.pointer
    @children
    identifies the elements which are the children of the root node.
    Usage
    req
    Datatype
    teidata.pointer
    @ord
    indicates whether or not the root is ordered.
    Usage
    opt
    Datatype
    teidata.xTruthValue
    @outDegree
    gives the out degree of the root, the number of its children.
    Usage
    opt
    Datatype
    teidata.count
    Contained by

    nets

    :
    • tree
    May contain

    core

    :
    • label
    Example
    <root xml:id="vp1" children="#vb1 #pn1" outDegree="2"> <label>VP</label> </root> <leaf xml:id="vb1"/> <leaf xml:id="pn1"/>
